1.text: Also at this my heart shall tremble, and it will leap from its place.

2.text: Hearing, hear ye, to the noise of his voice, and the growling going out from his mouth.

3.text: He will let it go free under all the heavens, and his light upon the wings of the earth.

4.text: After him a voice shall rear; he will thunder with the voice of his majesty: and he will not leave them behind when his voice shall be heard.

5.text: God will thunder with his voice of wonder, doing great things, and we shall not know.

6.text: For he will say to the snow, Be it on earth; and to the shower of rain, and to the shower of the rains of his strength.

7.text: He will seal in the hand of every man, for all men to know his work.

8.text: And the beast shall go into the covert, and shall dwell in its habitation.

9.text: From the chamber shall come forth the whirlwind, and cold from the scatterings.

10.text: From the breath of God ice will be given, and the breadth of the waters in being straitened.

11.text: Also by watering he will cast down the cloud: he will scatter the cloud of his light:

12.text: Being turned by his guidance to their doing all that he commanded them upon the face of the habitable globe of the earth.

13.text: If for the rod, if for his land, if for mercy, it shall find him.

14.text: Give ear to this, O Job: stand and consider the wonders of God.

15.text: Shalt thou know in Godâ€™s setting upon them, and he caused the light of his cloud to shine?

16.text: Shalt thou know upon the poisings of the cloud, the wonders of the complete of knowledges?

17.text: That thy garments are warm in quieting the earth from the south?

18.text: Wilt thou spread out with him to the clouds, strong as the sight of a melted mass?

19.text: Make known to us what we shall say to him we shall not set in order from the face of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be recounted to him that I shall speak? If a man spake, then shall he be swallowed down.

21.text: And now they saw not the bright light that is in the clouds: and the wind passed over and it will cleanse them.

22.text: From the north, gold shall come: upon God terrible majesty.

23.text: The Almighty we found not: great of power and judgment, and much justice, he will not afflict.

24.text: For this, men shall fear him: he will not see all the wise of heart.
